H0.text: Plants help hold soil in place to slow erosion.

H1.text: Flowers help hold soil in place to slow erosion.

H2.text: Bacteria are the organisms that help hold soil in place to slow erosion.

H3.text: Animals help hold soil in place to slow erosion.

A4.text: Ant wastes serve as organic fertilizer.

A5.text: Some plants have deep roots that are able to locate water stored deep underground, and others have shallower roots that are capable of extending longer distances to collect recent rainwater.

A6.text: The roots of the plants bind the soil together, and interweave with other roots, forming a more solid mass that is less susceptible to both water and wind erosion.

A7.text: The removal of vegetation increases the rate of surface erosion.
